Reference

dplyr verbs

tbl(<src_dbi>)

Use dplyr verbs with a remote database table

arrange(<tbl_lazy>)

Arrange rows by column values

copy_to(<src_sql>)

Copy a local data frame to a remote database

collapse(<tbl_sql>) compute(<tbl_sql>) collect(<tbl_sql>)

Compute results of a query

distinct(<tbl_lazy>)

Subset distinct/unique rows

do(<tbl_sql>)

Perform arbitrary computation on remote backend

filter(<tbl_lazy>)

Subset rows using column values

head(<tbl_lazy>)

Subset the first rows

group_by(<tbl_lazy>)

Group by one or more variables

inner_join(<tbl_lazy>) left_join(<tbl_lazy>) right_join(<tbl_lazy>) full_join(<tbl_lazy>) semi_join(<tbl_lazy>) anti_join(<tbl_lazy>)

Join SQL tables

intersect(<tbl_lazy>) union(<tbl_lazy>) union_all(<tbl_lazy>) setdiff(<tbl_lazy>)

SQL set operations

mutate(<tbl_lazy>)

Create, modify, and delete columns

pull(<tbl_sql>)

Extract a single column

select(<tbl_lazy>) rename(<tbl_lazy>) rename_with(<tbl_lazy>) relocate(<tbl_lazy>)

Subset, rename, and reorder columns using their names

slice_min(<tbl_lazy>) slice_max(<tbl_lazy>) slice_sample(<tbl_lazy>)

Subset rows using their positions

summarise(<tbl_lazy>)

Summarise each group to one row

Built-in database backends

simulate_access()

Backend: MS Access

simulate_hana()

Backend: SAP HANA

backend-hive

Backend: Hive

backend-impala

Backend: Impala

backend-mssql

Backend: SQL server

simulate_mysql()

Backend: MySQL/MariaDB

simulate_odbc()

Backend: ODBC

simulate_oracle()

Backend: Oracle

simulate_postgres()

Backend: PostgreSQL

simulate_redshift()

Backend: Redshift

simulate_sqlite()

Backend: SQLite

simulate_teradata()

Backend: Teradata

Database connection

in_schema()

Refer to a table in a schema

memdb_frame() tbl_memdb() src_memdb()

Create a database table in temporary in-memory database.

remote_name() remote_src() remote_con() remote_query() remote_query_plan()

Metadata about a remote table

SQL generation

build_sql()

Build a SQL string.

escape() escape_ansi() sql_vector()

Escape/quote a string.

ident() is.ident()

Flag a character vector as SQL identifiers

partial_eval()

Partially evaluate an expression.

sql() is.sql() as.sql()

SQL escaping.

sql_expr() sql_call2()

Generate SQL from R expressions

translate_sql() translate_sql_()

Translate an expression to sql.

window_order() window_frame()

Override window order and frame

dbplyr Backends

Documentation for authors of new dbplyr backends

db_copy_to() db_compute() db_collect() db_table_temporary()

Database I/O generics

db_connection_describe() sql_join_suffix() db_sql_render() dbplyr_edition()

Miscellaneous database generics

sql_expr_matches() sql_translation() sql_table_analyze() sql_table_index() sql_query_explain() sql_query_fields() sql_query_save() sql_query_wrap() sql_query_rows() sql_query_select() sql_query_join() sql_query_semi_join() sql_query_set_op()

SQL generation generics

sql_escape_logical() sql_escape_date() sql_escape_datetime() sql_escape_raw()

SQL escaping/quoting generics

Contents

dbplyr is a part of the tidyverse, an ecosystem of packages designed with common APIs and a shared philosophy. Learn more at tidyverse.org.
